errors.formattedMessage:
Warning: Transient storage as defined by EIP-1153 can break the composability of smart contracts: Since transient storage is cleared only at the end of the transaction and not at the end of the outermost call frame to the contract within a transaction, your contract may unintentionally misbehave when invoked multiple times in a complex transaction. To avoid this, be sure to clear all transient storage at the end of any call to your contract. The use of transient storage for reentrancy guards that are cleared at the end of the call is safe.
  --> contracts/Core/libraries/TransientStorage.sol:14:13:
   |
14 |             tstore(slot, dataLength)
   |             ^^^^^^
errors.message: Transient storage as defined by EIP-1153 can break the composability of smart contracts: Since transient storage is cleared only at the end of the transaction and not at the end of the outermost call frame to the contract within a transaction, your contract may unintentionally misbehave when invoked multiple times in a complex transaction. To avoid this, be sure to clear all transient storage at the end of any call to your contract. The use of transient storage for reentrancy guards that are cleared at the end of the call is safe.

documentation.text: @dev Interface of the ERC-20 standard as defined in the ERC.

@dev Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by
 a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance.
@dev Returns the value of tokens in existence.
@dev Returns the value of tokens owned by `account`.

@dev Returns the remaining number of tokens that `spender` will be
 allowed to spend on behalf of `owner` through {transferFrom}. This is
 zero by default.
 This value changes when {approve} or {transferFrom} are called.

@dev Sets a `value` amount of tokens as the allowance of `spender` over the
 caller's tokens.
 Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.
 IMPORTANT: Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk
 that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate
 transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race
 condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the
 desired value afterwards:
 https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729
 Emits an {Approval} event.

@dev Moves a `value` amount of tokens from `from` to `to` using the
 allowance mechanism. `value` is then deducted from the caller's
 allowance.
 Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.
 Emits a {Transfer} event.
@notice Owner balance of an id.
@notice Spender allowance of an id.
@notice Checks if a spender is approved by an owner as an operator
@notice Mint LP shares to user
@notice Burn LP shares from user
@notice ERC6909Claims inherits ERC6909 and implements an internal burnFrom function

@notice Manage batch settlement window timing
 @return windowActive Whether batch window is currently active
@notice Update volume tracking after successful swap
@notice Creates a new pool using library logic

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct PoolManagerLib.PoolManagerStorage storage pointer,uint256) view returns (struct PoolInfo memory)

@notice Remove liquidity from a pool - OPTIMAL IMPLEMENTATION
@notice Swap assets in a pool - lean implementation

documentation.text: @notice Interface for claims over a contract balance, wrapped as a ERC6909

@notice Called within a flash session to perform composed operations
 @param data Arbitrary calldata for the callback logic

@title FlashAccounting
 @notice Minimal transient-storage based per-session ledger for user/token deltas

@notice Add to the user's net delta for a given token

@notice Clear the user's delta for a given token

@notice Configure protocol fee. Setting treasury to 0 disables fees.
